name: Life in Bunker
description: You've been elected as the new Bunker Warden! Now you must take control over a group of fellow bunker residents and try to make them last until the surface becomes habitable.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2.4 Ghz Intel Core i5 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 640M DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 1 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 8 or higher Processor: 3.0 Ghz Intel Core i5 or i7 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 650M or higher DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 1 GB available space

reviews.review_text: Well first early impression for the hour I played was good. But it would be nice to have a way to keep tab on the embryo gnerator how many kids you need to crack out to keep the population stable first bunker death by old age. Live and learn Also I have 2 GPUs and sometimes it locks up just for like 3 seconds but no crashes yet.
This game learned me how much useless old people are to the society! 8/10

the NPC die too fast, get old too fast, the mines deplete too fast, the logic is bad for NPC to fix things that are broken first and you can't do anything but yell at the computer. You can set your recycle machines to produce building materials, the only saving path for no more mines.

I really enjoy this game. It's simple but I found it addictive and fun as is, which makes me excited to see what it becomes with updates/mods/dlc. I don't understand all the negative reviews. For 15.99 I would say this game is a fun bargain. If I get 15 hours of enjoyment out of this game it is definately worth it. I have noticed the communication with the devs is pretty good and responsive so I expect lots of updates and improvements.
a great game and worth the money but needs to step up and update more now that fallout shelter is free on pc

I was really looking for a game like this. The most obvious compare for me is actually EVIL GENIUS. Unfortunately there was not as much love put into this one I am afraid.   After about 4 hours I discovered everything. So far I don't see a reason to play it again. At first Life In Bunker is quite tough but it gets easy incredibly fast. There should be at least kind of a campaign. But right now the only play mode is not really offering a lot.  I am really not particular on spending money for games, but this one is not yet worth the price tag. I hope there will be features added or there will be mods.

It's a micro managing game. Resourses run out. Getting to next level to get more resourses isn't easy as one has run out of resources to build required machines. I did not see the people using beds and eating at the table. I could never get the cook to cook. I don't know if those things are even required, due to that. The game is slow moving and I did not realize how unenjoyable it was until it was too late to request a refund.
User interface and graphics are absolutely terrible.
